page.title: 02AIR STATION LOSSIEMOUTH
page.content: Lossiemouth became a military airfield during World War Two. It trained pilots to fly bombers. After the war it became a naval base, until 1972 when it was taken over by the R.A.F. Since then R.A.F. Lossiemouth has grown rapidly. Three hundred civilians work on the base, their jobs varying from clerical work to washing aircraft. Two and a half thousand uniformed people are based there, involved in at least sixty different kinds of jobs. For instance dog-handling, policemen and firemen. Air Traffic Control also play an important part, as R.A.F. Lossiemouth is the largest operational flying station in the U.K. It is one of the most important stations in the defence of this country and for N.A.T.O.
